==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|s=页}}

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etym}}
{{Han compound|卩|首|ls=p|c1=kneeling posture|c2=head}} – head of a kneeling person, emphasising “head”.

{{lang|zh|頁}} and {{och-l|首}} were originally the same pictographic character with the same meaning of “head”, and the graphical difference was that {{lang|zh|頁}} also included the body in addition to the head of the person.

By the {{w|Eastern Han Dynasty}} {{defdate|25–220 CE}}, {{lang|zh|頁}} has been used as an alternative popular form of {{och-l|葉|leaf; page}} to mean “sheet; page (of paper)”, which is its main meaning today.

The original sense of “head” is preserved in the radical {{lang|zh|頁}} (“body part”), used in characters such as {{zh-l|*頭|head}}, {{zh-l|*頸|neck}}.
